name: The Trevor Project
description: The Trevor Project is the leading national organization providing crisis intervention and suicide prevention services to LGBTQ+ young people under 25. Founded in 1998, they provide 24/7 crisis counseling through phone, text, and chat services. Their mission is to end suicide among LGBTQ+ young people by providing life-affirming and life-saving resources. Services include crisis intervention, suicide prevention, educational resources, advocacy, and community support. All services are free, confidential, and available nationwide.
source: Verified from official website and multiple sources
hours_of_operation: 24 hours a day, 7 days a week
eligibility_requirements: LGBTQ+ young people under 25 years old
populations_served: LGBTQ+ young people under 25, youth in crisis, individuals at risk of suicide
cost_information: Free services - no cost to participants
notes: VERIFIED INFORMATION: All contact information verified on 2025-01-27. CITATIONS: Contact information verified from official website https://www.thetrevorproject.org. Crisis hotline 1-866-488-7386 confirmed working and listed on multiple sources including official website, PFLAG, and government resources. Address PO Box 69232, West Hollywood, CA 90069 verified from official contact page. Website https://www.thetrevorproject.org confirmed working and current. Services and mission verified from official website including 24/7 crisis intervention and suicide prevention. Organization is a registered 501(c)(3) nonprofit with EIN 95-4681287. Additional contact methods include text START to 678678 and chat at TheTrevorProject.org/Get-Help. All information cross-referenced with multiple sources for consistency.
